messages.message: Howdy - looking to track down what the reason is for using tensorflow 1.5.0-rc1. It appears like it was added as a requirement in September, long after the release candidate was the latest version (1.11.0rc1 was latest at that point, with 1.5.1 available in the 1.5.x branch) so I’m assuming there’s a backstory. Is it something that has been fixed in the meantime? Can we upgrade to a non-release-candidate version? We can stick with 1.5.1 if there are concerns about compatibility.
It is used exclusively in `distributed-tasks/celery/image-tasks`, as near as I can tell.

```
commit 433516ff6f46c2ba9b093029025bda88b9c82db2
Author: sudeep-ib <39871406+sudeep-ib@users.noreply.github.com>
Date:   Mon Sep 17 23:42:03 2018 +0530

    Add python dependencies for local dev env (#7941)

diff --git a/tools/devtools/code-dependencies/python/requirements.txt b/tools/devtools/code-dependencies/python/requirements.txt
index 93d65241b8..5ef217e772 100644
--- a/tools/devtools/code-dependencies/python/requirements.txt
+++ b/tools/devtools/code-dependencies/python/requirements.txt
@@ -137,4 +137,9 @@
  mock==2.0.0

 # Bleach - HTML sanitizing
- bleach==2.1.3
\ No newline at end of file
+ bleach==2.1.3
+
+# Deep learning
+ tensorflow==1.5.0-rc1
+ keras==2.0.9
+ h5py==2.7.1
```
@sudeep I’m not sure if you “own” this code or not, but maybe you have ideas?
team-mint is the right channel for the tensorflow work. @Ted @Chetan @Divya @Loc @lydia
to the best of my knowledge, I don’t think there’s a reason why we used that specific version. I’m sure 1.5.1 will work perfectly fine.
In fact, i’m not aware of any instance using tensorflow right now and some if not most of our work is pytorch. i think upgrading is fine.
I don’t actually see it imported anywhere. Can I remove it from `requirements.txt`?
You are… 100% correct. It’s only used by @Ted in an experimental thing that doesn’t look like it’s been touched in over a year.
Hi! Yes we can remove it!
